paper_abstract: Motivated by reducing communication overhead and prolonging network lifetime in multi-hop wireless networks, we propose an energy-efficient dominating tree construction (EEDTC) algorithm to construct a dominating tree that can serve as a communication backbone in wireless infrastructures. The algorithm uses k-hop neighbors' information (k is an element of [1, D-G], where D-G is the diameter of graph G). EEDTC has a theoretical approximation factor of at most 9. When k is equal to 1, it has O(n) message complexity and O(inverted right perpendicularn(1-1)/D(G)inverted left perpendicular - 1) time complexity. Due to the low message complexity, EEDTC performs well on energy consumption. The energy-aware ranking technique that is introduced can also balance energy consumption in the network, and hence reduce the probability of network failures caused by energy depletion of back bone nodes. paper_title: EEDTC: Energy-efficient dominating tree construction in multi-hop wireless networks
